summary: The Development Assistance Committee (DAC) is an integral component of international cooperation, primarily focusing on enhancing development aid effectiveness among member countries. Within the EU legal and regulatory framework, the DAC plays a pivotal role in shaping policies that govern development assistance, ensuring alignment with global standards and commitments. The committee facilitates dialogue and coordination among donor nations, promoting transparency and accountability in aid distribution. By establishing guidelines and best practices, the DAC contributes to the EU's broader objectives of sustainable development and poverty alleviation, reinforcing the Union's commitment to fostering equitable global partnerships in development cooperation.
